name: GetAggregatedConnections
description:
Retrieve all aggregated network connections from Datadog.

This tool is used to get a comprehensive view of all aggregated network connections. It's ideal for monitoring and analyzing network activity.

parameters.name: start_time_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Unix timestamp for the start of the query window. Defaults to 15 minutes before `end_time_unix_timestamp` if not provided.

value_schema.description: Unix timestamp (number of seconds since epoch) of the start of the query window. If not provided, the start of the query window is 15 minutes before the `to` timestamp. If neither `from` nor `to` are provided, the query window is `[now - 15m, now]`.

parameters.name: end_query_window
parameters.description: Unix timestamp for the end of the query window. Defaults to current time if not provided.

value_schema.description: Unix timestamp (number of seconds since epoch) of the end of the query window. If not provided, the end of the query window is the current time. If neither `from` nor `to` are provided, the query window is `[now - 15m, now]`.

parameters.name: group_by_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to group connections by, with a maximum of 10 fields.

value_schema.description: Comma-separated list of fields to group connections by. The maximum number of group_by(s) is 10.

parameters.name: filter_by_tags
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter connections by for more targeted querying.

value_schema.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter connections by.

parameters.name: connection_limit
parameters.description: Set the number of connections to be returned, maximum 7500, default 100.

value_schema.description: The number of connections to be returned. The maximum value is 7500. The default is 100.
